result.execSummary:
The defendant Eric J Wojciechowski was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Possession of Methamphetamine [Modifiers: Repeater], a class I felony, Wisconsin Statutes 961.41(3g)(g).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes:
Dodge Correctional Institution as reception facility.
Defendant is eligible for Challenge Incarceration Program.
Defendant is eligible for the Substance Abuse Program.

If the stayed portion of the sentence is imposed and there are outstanding financial obligations, the supervising agent shall provide current financial information to the court.  A civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant and in favor of restitution victims and governmental entities for any balances due.  All available enforcement actions will be used to collect all debt.

miscConds.notes:
$500.00 cash bond applied.
If probation or extended supervision is allowed to expire or is revoked with outstanding financial obligations, the supervising agent shall notify the court 10 days prior to the revocation or discharge and provide current financial information.  A civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant in favor of restitution victims and governmental entities for any balances due.  All available enforcement actions will be used to collect all debt.
Must be employed or going to school full-time or a combination of the two.

Must remain absolutely sober.
Must not possess or consume any controlled substances or drug paraphernalia, unless and as prescribed by a licensed physician.
Must not go onto any premises where alcohol is sold.

Must successfully complete the Barron County Drug Court Program.
Must complete any and all evaluations, counseling, treatment and follow-up recommended by Probation Agent for anger management, alcohol or drug abuse and any psychological evaluations.

timeConds.notes:
Prior to release from jail, Defendant must meet with Jolee Buhr, the Drug Court Coordinator.

09/30/2014 AMENDED: COURT ORDERS 24 HOURS JAIL TO BEGIN IMMEDIATELY WITH HUBER. DEFENDANT TO BE RELEASED TOMORROW MORNING.

01/26/2017 AMENDED: COURT ORDERS 60 DAYS CONDITIONAL JAIL TIME TO BEGIN ON 01/18/2017.

02/09/2017 AMENDED - COURT GRANTS HUBER ON CONDITIONS JAIL TERM OF 60 DAYS.

Defendant Eric J Wojciechowski in court with attorney John G. Hinde.  Defendant Eric J Wojciechowski in custody.  Russell E. Berg appeared for the State of Wisconsin.

4:22  Court relates.  State gives appearances.
4:22  Atty. Hinde relates.
4:25  K.W. makes statement.
4:28  State relates and makes recommendation.
4:41  Atty. Hinde makes argument.
5:02  Eric Wojciechowski makes statement.
5:07  Atty. Hinde relates.
5:07  Court questions counsel.
5:08  Court relates.
5:27  Court gives sentence.

Wisconsin prison system 7 years and zero months imposed and stayed 
(5 years and zero months initial confinement; 2 years and zero months extended supervision)  Stayed.
5 years probation with the following conditions:  
180 days jail with credit for 169 days served.  
Successfully complete the Barron County Drug Court Program.
Remain absolutely sober.
Do not possess or use any controlled substances or drug paraphernalia, unless and as prescribed by licensed physician.
May not go onto any premises where alcohol is sold.
Any and all evaluations, counseling, treatment and follow-up recommended by PO for anger management, alcohol or drug abuse, psychological evaluations.
Must be employed or going to school fulltime, or a combination of the two.
Pay costs and assessments with DNA assessment.

Prior to getting out of jail, Eric to meet with Jolee Burr the Drug Court Coordinator.

Written explanation of sentence given to defendant.
Voting rights given to defendant.


Court finds defendant is eligible for CIP and Substance Abuse Program

5:39  Court concludes.
